result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian M Crume was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian M Crume is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian M Crume was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DA Kohlwey requesting corrections to the JOC
Filed by Atty Roger Klopp
Filed by Atty Roger Klopp

Defendant Brian M Crume in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1. Repeater dismissed. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 18 months probation, $518 costs, posted cash bond applied. Submit DNA sample. Ct. 2 dismissed.  Court granted 20 days jail credit.

Defendant Brian M Crume in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appearing on warrant, quashed, bond cont'd  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

9:21 A.M. Defendant Brian M Crume in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, stands mute, not guilty pleas entered, 9:25 A.M. Defendant Brian M Crume in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested by Atty Klopp.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brian M Crume in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Klopp argues to have bond  returned to poster and for bond to be amended to a signature bond or lower cash bond.  State opposes current bond be amended to signature bond.  Court amends cash bond to $300.00.  Atty Klopp states poster wants $300 bond be kept towards bond.  Return remainder to poster.
